result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Samuel Matthew Laverack

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Samuel Matthew Laverack in court with attorney Rebecca M Coffee.  Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case dismissed and read into cases 15CT213 and 15cm559.
Wisconsin Community Service compliance letter received and filed.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 25, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Samuel Matthew Laverack in court with attorney Rebecca M Coffee.  Bryan C. Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense counsel is requesting adjournment. State has no objections. Court grants. Defense counsel is requesting that the defendant not be monitored by WCS while he is at his Army training. Court grants that request and suspends the monitoring 08/16/2015 thru 08/31/2015 and will be back on WCS thereafter.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 25, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Court received information from Wisconsin Community Services regarding defendant's compliance/non-compliance.
fax dated 6/29/15 filed by Atty. Coffee; requesting the Court to grant Mr. Laverack absence from WCS will he is in training in Ohio.
